abstract: The government’s case against Sergey Aleynikov, a former Goldman Sachs programmer, highlighted the importance of proprietary computer codes in the profitable high-frequency trading by Wall Street firms.
snippet: The government’s case against Sergey Aleynikov, a former Goldman Sachs programmer, highlighted the importance of proprietary computer codes in the profitable high-frequency trading by Wall Street firms.
lead_paragraph: 8:16 p.m. | Updated The case that put a spotlight on the world of ultra-fast, computer-driven trading of stocks has ended in a conviction.

headline.main: Former Goldman Programmer Found Guilty of Code Theft
